meanings.definition: A device placed on the fingerboard of a guitar to raise the pitch of all the strings at once.
meanings.sent1: I used a capo to play higher notes on my guitar.
meanings.sent2: The musician placed the capo on the guitar to change the sound.
meanings.sent3: The capo on the guitar felt like a magic tool for music.
meanings.sent4: With the capo on, the guitar sang like a bird in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The capo transformed the guitar into a new instrument.

meanings.definition: A leader or chief, especially in a criminal organization.
meanings.sent1: The capo of the gang made all the decisions.
meanings.sent2: The capo was feared and respected by all in the organization.
meanings.sent3: The capo's tough exterior hid a love for fluffy kittens.
meanings.sent4: The capo ruled the criminal world with an iron fist.
meanings.sent5: The capo's presence commanded authority and obedience.

meanings.definition: A detachable cover for an object.
meanings.sent1: I put the capo on my pen to keep the ink from drying out.
meanings.sent2: The capo protected the fragile object from dust and damage.
meanings.sent3: The capo on the pen was like a tiny shield against accidents.
meanings.sent4: The capo acted as a guardian for the precious item.
meanings.sent5: The capo added a layer of security to the valuable object.

meanings.definition: A high-ranking member of the Mafia.
meanings.sent1: The capo was known for his influence and power in the Mafia.
meanings.sent2: The capo controlled a vast network of criminal activities.
meanings.sent3: The capo's favorite hobby was baking cookies for his crew.
meanings.sent4: The capo's words were as sharp as a knife in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The capo's presence sent shivers down the spines of his enemies.
